section.title: Review -- Exponents and Logarithms
section.p: As you can see from the last activity, we are going to do a lot of work with exponential functions. In this activity, we will pause to review laws of exponents and logarithms. The list of the identities can be found in .

introduction.p: Express each of the following using each distinct base only once using only once.

In some of our problems, it will be important to use our laws of exponents "in reverse." This means we have to recognize the right-hand side of an identity, and rewrite using the left-hand side. For the following, rewrite as directed.

task.p: Rewrite (1+\iota)^7 so that (1+\iota)^2 is a factor in your answer.
Rewrite the following as a quadratic expression: v^{2n}-2v^n+11

section.p: Logarithms also have identities that need to be used forward and backwards. We will almost always use the natural logarithm in this course.

introduction.p: Expand each expression as much as possible, so that each logarithm has the simplest possible argument.
Condense each expression so that you have a single logarithm in your answer.
